intro: Rhizobolus glaber, commonly known as the smooth rhizobolus, is a lesser-known plant species with distinctive botanical features. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its erect, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its root system is fibrous and adapted for anchoring in various soil types. Rhizobolus glaber is often found in moist, temperate environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
